body:
I'm sorry to hear that. I'm pretty sure this is related to the following change: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/6277. Quick search in the repo of the new jwt library we changed to seem to indicate issues and confusion related to the value type of the aud (audience) field: https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Agolang-jwt%2Fjwt+aud&type=issues

This needs to be looked into. One problem with the change was that we had problems testing it. So; I hope you would be able to test a beta build, should we come up with a possible code fix? And also; are you capable of building rclone from source yourself, so that you could try things without we having to publish a prebuilt beta binary?

@albertony It seems seems possible that using `StandardClaims` rather than `RegisteredClaims` will fix this?

Remember you can push to a branch on github.com/rclone/rclone to get a prebuilt binary and `make btest` will (if running on linux anyway) copy the URL of the result in markdown format to paste into an issue

> It seems seems possible that using `StandardClaims` rather than `RegisteredClaims` will fix this?

Unfortunately it will not work with latest version of jwt-go, v5, released a couple of months ago:

> The old StandardClaims struct, which has already been deprecated in v4 is now removed.

Creating new claim type from scratch seem to be the (longer) way around this:

> If they created a new claim type from scratch, they now need to implemented the proper getter functions.
Oh, for a patch we could use the StandardClaims, since we are still using v4 of jwt-go. And then we have time to work on longer term fix compatible with v5 later. Will see if I can do that now.

issue.title: Box: Fix reconnect failing with HTTP 400 Bad Request

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
The error is:

> Error: failed to configure token with jwt authentication: jwtutil: failed making auth request: 400 Bad Request

With the following additional debug information:

> jwtutil: Response Body: {"error":"invalid_grant","error_description":"Please check the 'aud' claim. Should be a string"}

Problem is that in jwt-go the RegisteredClaims type has Audience field (aud claim) that is a list, while box apparantly expects it to be a singular string. In jwt-go v4 we currently use there is an alternative type StandardClaims which matches what box wants. Unfortunately StandardClaims is marked as deprecated, and is removed in the newer v5 version, so we this is a short term fix only. Edit: Suggested long term fix compatible with v5 here: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/7116.

Fixes #7114

body: @minnieshi There should be a beta build ready in a few minutes here: https://beta.rclone.org/branch/box-jwt-fix/. Would you mind testing it to see if this solves the issue? Edit: This is a short term solution intended for patch release. There is now also a separate solution intended for longer term, so if the above beta works it would be really nice if you could also run a test on the beta from this: https://beta.rclone.org/branch/jwt-v5-compatibility/

issue.title: Compatibility with jwt-go (golang-jwt) v5

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Including the StandardClaims implementation from jwt-go v4 directly into rclone's jwtutil. In jwt-go v4 it was marked as deprecated, before removed in v5. The box backend needs this, due to the singular string audience field, see: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/7114.

This is a possible long-term solution for the jwt-go v4 fix in #7115. Not the best solution, but not the worst either...

Maybe we should rename our variant from StandardClaims, which is the original name that was used in jwt-go, to something like LegacyClaims - which avoids confusing contributors into thinking this is one to choose by default?

Maybe we could just go ahead and update jwt-go to v5 as well?

> Oh, for a patch we could use the StandardClaims, since we are still using v4 of jwt-go. And then we have time to work on longer term fix compatible with v5 later. Will see if I can do that now.

That looks like a nice small patch perfect for the patch release :-)
@minnieshi does the above work for you? I'd like to roll this into v1.63.1 but I need confirmation that it works for you first - thank you :-)

I am very sorry that I didn't respond sooner. I was a bit sick and also we just went to use v1.62 . 
I will have to remember to check/test tomorrow.

Perhaps related to what I'm experiencing, using the latest GIT rclone -- a couple of days ago or so, I cannot complete the API reconnect process with Google.  It just hangs.  I do not, however, get the above error -- possibly because I don't allow it to hang forever (CTRL-C).

I compiled this branch (MacOS) and it did not solve the problem that I am experiencing.  So perhaps mine is unrelated -- I don't want to hijack this ticket.    I just tried the latest master branch:

rclone v1.63.0-beta.7072.4f8dab8bc
- os/version: darwin 12.6.7 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 21.6.0 (x86_64)
- os/type: darwin
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.20.5
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none

and the symptom I experience is the same.  I get through the dialog and "Continue" then it hangs.

issue.title: Support rclone v1.63.0

repository.name: librclone
repository.description: Rust bindings for librclone. Automatically compiles rclone as a library and links it into your Rust application.

issue.body: A new rclone release is out as of [2023-06-30](https://rclone.org/changelog/#v1-63-0-2023-06-30)

body:
I've merged @albertony 's quick fix to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.63.1

@forrie I don't think you are experiencing the same issue - likely you have a firewall problem. Probably best to [post on the rclone forum](https://forum.rclone.org/) about this to get some help.
